definition: point of a spear/edge of a tool/vanguard/forward (in sports team)
gold/chemical element Au/generic term for lustrous and ductile metals/money/golden/highly respected/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
to cross swords/to have a confrontation (with sb)
Lei Feng (1940-1962), made into a model of altruism and dedication to the Party by propaganda from 1963 onwards
Tse Ting-Fung or Nicholas Tse (1980-), Cantopop star
to oppose each other with equal harshness (idiom); tit for tat/measure for measure
tip (of pencil, spear etc)/sharp point/cutting edge/spearhead/vanguard
cutting edge or point of a knife, sword or tool
to charge and break through enemy lines

sentences.english: Frontogenesis and frontolysis have decisive effect on the precipitation near Meiyu front.
sentences.chinese: 鋒生鋒消對於梅雨鋒附近有無降水起到了重要的作用。

sentences.english: Three front grind sword for a decade in which several years of life.
sentences.chinese: 十年磨劍三日鋒，數載人生在其中。

sentences.english: Just what is this fascinating science that is the center of so much activity?
sentences.chinese: 有如此活躍的話鋒恰恰是這門學科的迷人之處。

sentences.english: Lastly, a physic conceptual model is advanced for the typical Meiyu frontal rainstorm system.
sentences.chinese: 最後，提出了典型梅雨鋒暴雨系統的物理概念模型。

sentences.english: The winger nearly had his shirt ripped in half.
sentences.chinese: 那邊鋒隊員幾乎將他的球衫撕成兩半。

sentences.english: They're getting production and size from the center position.
sentences.chinese: 他們正從中鋒位置得到產出和塊兒頭。

sentences.english: He can play either as a second striker or wide on the left or right.
sentences.chinese: 他即可踢二前鋒，也可踢左右翼鋒。

definition: double-edged sword/CL:口[kou3],把[ba3]/classifier for blows of a sword
(name of states and dynasties at several different periods)/surname Qi
neat/even/level with/identical/simultaneous/all together/to even sth out
pen/pencil/writing brush/to write or compose/the strokes of Chinese characters/classifier for sums of money, deals/CL:支[zhi1],枝[zhi1]
(bound form) crass/stupid/rude/(used to represent the sounds of "ru", "lu" etc in loanwords)
surname Lu/Lu, ancient state of China 魯國|鲁国[Lu3 guo2]/Lu, short name for Shandong 山東|山东[Shan1 dong1]
to gallop/to assist/to attack/to wade/great/old variant of 憑|凭[ping2]
